channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VT

  • City: SOUTH BURLINGTON
  • State: VT

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg fell off Vanline 300 on to the grate at the end of the line DescribePack: impacted of falling off the van line to the grate caused the inner bag to leak from a small crack around the valve steam DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: PKg was placed in a red hazmat bin and taken to QA staging area

  • State: VT

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING DUE TO WET SPOT ON CORNER OF BOX. STATION QA WAS NOTIFIED AND PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED AND PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT BIN. DescribePack: LID ON METAL DRUM IS BULGING (HARD TO CAPTURE CLEARLY IN PHOTOS). UNCLEAR HOW THIS HAPPENED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: STATION QA WAS NOTIFIED AND PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED AND PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT BIN.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

item.title: Report X-2022070084
item.description:
Report X-2022070084

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-10T21:08:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-02
  • City: WHITE RIVER JUNCTION
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 12 X 32 OUNCE CANS OF FLAMMABLE ALL WEATHER PVC CEMENT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM VERMONT USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 1244EA, GREEN MOUNTAIN ELECTRIC SUPPLY, 356 RATHE RD., COLCHESTER VT 05446.

item.title: Report X-2022051105
item.description:
Report X-2022051105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-10T21:08:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-18
  • City: SOUTH BURLINGTON
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: loose caps inside the box led to the damage. bottles inside the package were in plastic bags, ready for a leakage, but were not securely fastened closed DescribePack: no holes or tears in the packaging. only liquid damage on the top half of the package DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: package was put in a hazmat bin with absorbent pads
